result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph T Langlois was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file shall be applied to amounts due. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Nov 24, 2015: Condition of "Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons" is modified to:
Defendant shall not possess any instrument that could be construed as a dangerous weapon except for employment purposes wherein his use of the instrument is within the normal scope or routine of his job duties, or as otherwised authorized by his probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent, including continuing with the counseling def is currently undergoing with Affiliated Clinical Services for as long as they deem appropriate. 
Defendant shall pay Dept of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination thereof.

charges.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

Disposition Form
Sentencing hearing at 09-23-2015 09:00 am

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer. Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Reconvene, jury not present. Discussion on instructions and verdicts. Atty. Mark Bensen now also appears for State. Jury enters. Court instructs jury. Closing argument by counsel. Final instructions given by court. Alternate juror selected at random and excused, juror #121. Bailiff sworn and jury exits for deliberations. Reconvene, jury not present. Court reads a question received from the jury along with a proposed response. Counsel indicate no objections to court's response which will be submitted to the jury in writing. Recess. Reconvene with jury present. Jury has reached a verdict. Foreperson identified. Jury finds defendant not guilty of first degree reckless homicide; jury finds defendant not guilty of second degree reckless homicide; jury finds defendant guilty of homicide by negligent handling of dangerous weapon. Court polls jurors individually upon request of Atty Mayer. Court thanks jury and excuses them. State moves for judgment on verdict. Atty Mayer moves for judgment not withstanding verdict. Court grants State's motion and enters judgment on the guilty verdict. State requests PSI be ordered and requests def be remanded into custody pending sentencing. Atty Mayer takes no position on request for presentence investigation; requests bond be modified. Court denies motion for remand. State takes no position on modification of bond conditions. Bond amount and conditions modified.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 09:00 am. Record closed.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Reconvene with jury present. Witness: Detective Joel Clausing (WCSD). State rests. Jury excused. Atty Mayer moves to dismiss. Argument presented. Court denies motion. Following a recess, court questions defendant on his right to testify. Court finds defendant understands rights. Jury enters. Witnesses: Attorney Timothy James Algiers; Joseph Thomas L. Jury excused. Argument by counsel on objections. Jury returns. Continued testimony of Joseph Thomas L.. Witnesses: Dan M.; Joseph Michael K.; Patrick James R.; Dennis V.; Ane O.; Annah H.; Fr. David L.; Steven L.; Karen L. Defense rests. Jury excused. Statements by Atty Bensen on request to introduce rebuttal testimony. Court permits rebuttal testimony. Jury returns. Witness: Sgt. Amy S. State rests. Jury excused. Discussion regarding jury instructions and verdict. Recess.
Defense Opening Statement; 7/14/15

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Reconvene, jury not present. Jury enters. Witness: Karen L. Audio cd of 911 recording played to jury. Continued testimony of Karen L. Jury excused. Argument by counsel on objections. Jury returns. Continued testimony of Karen L. Witnesses: Investigator David Klopfenstein (WCSD); Deputy Christopher Killey (WCSD); James S. Wolf (retired WCSD detective). Court admonishes jury and excuses them. Agreement placed on record regarding photos to be introduced. Jury enters. Court admonishes jury to avoid local newspaper and radio. Witness: Dr Zelda Okia (associate medical examiner). Jury excused for recess. Discussion between court and counsel on video to be displayed. Jury enters. Witness: Detective Joel Clausing (WCSD). Court admonishes jury and excuses them for the day. Recess.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Record opened without jury panel present. Atty Mayer requests jury be allowed to take notes. Request granted. Discussion between court and counsel on other trial issues. Jury panel enters. Panel sworn and 23 called to box. Voir dire by court. Individual voir dire conducted with jurors #733, #204, #111, #439, #1915, #122. Entire panel returns to courtroom. Voir dire by counsel. Individual voir dire conducted with juror #967. Remaining panel returns. Continued voir dire by counsel. Counsel selects jury. Jury sworn. Court thanks balance of panel and excuses them. Court gives jury preliminary instructions. Jury excused. Atty Bensen moves to sequester witnesses. Court grants motion to sequester witnesses during testimony portion of trial. Detective Clausing may remain to assist the State. Opening statements by counsel. Court orders witnesses sequestered at this time. Witnesses: Deputy Scott D. Naumann (WCSD); Karen L. Court admonishes jury and excuses them for the day. Recess.
Motion Hearing; 7/2/15

All previously imposed non-monetary conditions of bond shall remain in full force and effect except as modified as follows:  Curfew modified to 6AM to 10PM; May leave Washington County to work at Mike and Mary Pat Peters farm on Hwy DW, Theresa on Saturday only; Defendant must be in company of parents or grandparents Caroline and Gene Langlois or Camilla or Gerone Moeller
Exhibit 1 and 2

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State.  Victims parents also present.  Matter before the court is defense letter regarding testimony/evidence.  Court will consider the defenses letter as a motion in Limine; Statements from defense, state; Court finds there are three prongs: 1) whether or not there is an acceptible/permissible purpose 2) are the issues presented relevant 3)  what evidence/information will be allowed.  Court finds, with the understanding defense would be extending a self defense case, 1) there is an acceptible/permissible purpose 2) elements have been met and it is relevant 3) testimony re: Pg. 3 point 1, Pg. 3 point 2, Pg. 3 point 3 will be allowed; Pg. 2 point 11 and Pg. 3 point 4 will not be allowed.  Statements from victims father, mother.
Letter received from Atty William Mayer
Motion hearing at 07-02-2015 08:30 am

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Case is firm for trial to commence July 14. Motions in limine are on file. Def motion #1 and #2; State not aware of any prior criminal records. Def motion #3, #4, #6 are granted. Def motion #5 court defers ruling until trial. State's motion #1, #3, #4 (granted in part), #5, #6 are granted. State's motion #2 ruling deferred until trial. State's motion #4 is adjourned in part for further hearing. Atty Mayer confirms that no Miranda hearing is needed. Court questions defendant and accepts defendant's waiver of Miranda hearing. Court will permit State to introduce statements.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark D. Bensen and Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State. Trial adj request is on file from the State. Atty Mayer indicates no Miranda/Goodchild hearing is necessary. Court will question defendant further at jury status hearing. State to file any motions prior to jury status hearing. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons; Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages or controlled substances without a valid prescription; Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; Defendant shall maintain his/her residence at his parents' home; Take all prescribed medications; Cooperate with mental health counseling; Defendant subject to electronic monitoring and shall pay the cost of same; Defendant may be outside home from 7:00AM to 6:00PM only but must remain in Washington County; When outside home, he must be at work, school, or in the company of a parent
Hearing on April 23, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty William A. Mayer.  Atty Stephanie L. Hanson for State. Competency report is on file and has been reviewed by counsel and defendant. Neither State nor defendant will challenge the findings in the report. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. Based on inquiry by the sheriff's dept, the court clarifies bond conditions. Atty Mayer requests bond amount and conditions be modified. State opposes modification but requests court outline specific purposes for def to be allowed outside the home. Court denies to reduce bond amount. Conditions modified regarding release during curfew hours. Atty to pt further with DA before deciding on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
